connector.description: Send passive checks to Nagios using JSendNSCA.

camel.sink.path.host.name: camel.sink.path.host
camel.sink.path.host.description: This is the address of the Nagios host where checks should be send.

camel.sink.path.port.name: camel.sink.path.port
camel.sink.path.port.description: The port number of the host.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.sendSync.name: camel.sink.endpoint.sendSync
camel.sink.endpoint.sendSync.description: Whether or not to use synchronous when sending a passive check. Setting it to false will allow Camel to continue routing the message and the passive check message will be send asynchronously.

camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.name: camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous
camel.sink.endpoint.synchronous.description: Sets whether synchronous processing should be strictly used, or Camel is allowed to use asynchronous processing (if supported).

camel.sink.endpoint.encryption.name: camel.sink.endpoint.encryption
camel.sink.endpoint.encryption.description: To specify an encryption method. One of: [NONE] [TRIPLE_DES] [XOR] [RIJNDAEL128] [RIJNDAEL192] [RIJNDAEL256] [BLOWFISH]

camel.sink.endpoint.password.name: camel.sink.endpoint.password
camel.sink.endpoint.password.description: Password to be authenticated when sending checks to Nagios.

camel.component.nagios.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.nagios.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.nagios.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.nagios.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.nagios.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.nagios.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.nagios.encryption.name: camel.component.nagios.encryption
camel.component.nagios.encryption.description: To specify an encryption method. One of: [NONE] [TRIPLE_DES] [XOR] [RIJNDAEL128] [RIJNDAEL192] [RIJNDAEL256] [BLOWFISH]

camel.component.nagios.password.name: camel.component.nagios.password
camel.component.nagios.password.description: Password to be authenticated when sending checks to Nagios.
